title: Holby City review with spoilers: Ric puts his faith in Max’s high-risk surgery
text:
Ric’s about to be a human guinea pig (Picture: BBC)

There was a lot going on in tonight’s Holby City, with Jac (Rosie Marcel), Chloe (Amy Lennox) and Serena (Catherine Russell) all returning after some time away, Essie (Kaye Wragg) facing having to give up baby Isla and Max McGerry (Jo Martin) being introduced to the cast. But by the end of the episode everybody’s thoughts will have been on Ric Griffin (Hugh Quarshie) and his decision to have super-risky surgery to remove his brain tumour.

Serena heard about this surgery from Max and Ric, without realising that Ric was the patient under discussion. She said she would advise the patient whose MRI scan they were looking at ‘not to start any box sets.’ When Ric told her it was his scan they were looking at she was mortified. She tried to persuade him not to have the surgery, which has never before been successfully tried on a human. ‘I don’t want my friend to be a dead guinea pig,’ she said. ‘If I can’t be a surgeon, what is the reason for my existence?’ he argued.

We were left in no doubt that if anyone can do it, Max can. She was at Holby to see a patient of hers (Max is currently a neuro consultant at The Mythical St James’s, but we already know that Jo Martin is joining the Holby cast soon so expect an offer from the equally mythical Holby HR department very soon). The patient had long term neurological problems and more recent appendicitis, which meant Serena and Max had to work together – and the tension between them was highly amusing to watch. We also got to see at first hand that Max is a brilliant surgeon who is ice cool in a crisis. Exactly what we need if Ric is going to have any chance at all.

Meanwhile, Essie was shocked when Isla’s mother Frankie (Sophie Harkness) returned unexpectedly. She said she had her life sorted out, including a job in Birmingham, and she was now ready to take Isla back. This wouldn’t have been great news for Essie at the best of times because she’s become so attached to Isla, but she noticed that Frankie was ravenously hungry and also had some injuries which could have been caused by Connor, Isla’s father. Essie wasn’t happy to let Isla go under those circumstances. It was Sacha (Bob Barrett) who got through to Frankie and made her realise that she still wasn’t in a position to take care of a baby, so Isla is still in Essie’s care for now.

Still holding on to Isla (Picture: BBC)

Jac was back from a trip to Disneyland with Emma, and she seemed in an unusually mellow and happy mood. She didn’t even mind when Fletch (Alex Walkinshaw) and Nicky (Belinda Owusu) used a picture of her dressed as Elsa from Frozen as a screensaver. This sunny mood didn’t last long, though. We heard that Emma had spent most of the time they were away talking to Jonny and his wife Stacey on the phone. Then Jac got a call and told Kian (Ramin Karimloo) she’d have to go as Emma’s babysitter had double-booked herself – but on her way out she was apologising to someone and saying she never messes up like this. What’s going on?

Cameron (Nic Jackman) was feeling the pressure already, as it was the day his mum’s body was being returned to the UK and he had another funeral to arrange. Still eaten up with guilt over the way he stood by and let Evan die, he was further upset by Chloe asking him about Evan’s death. She hadn’t known that Cameron was present at the time and thought he’d died alone. ‘Was he in any pain?’ she wanted to know. ‘In my opinion, not nearly enough,’ was his honest reply.
